org.jtrim.image.transform

Class AffineImageTransformer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.image.transform.AffineImageTransformer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataConverter<ImageTransformerData,TransformedImage>, ImageTransformer
    Deprecated. 
    Use AffineTransformationStep instead. Defines an ImageTransformer transforming an image based on an affine transformation.

    This AffineImageTransformer defines the offset so, that (0, 0) offset means that the center of the source image will be transformed to the center of the destination image.

    Thread safety

    Instances of this class are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    Methods of this interface are not synchronization transparent and calling them while holding a lock should be avoided.

    @Deprecated
public final class AffineImageTransformer
extends java.lang.Object
implements ImageTransformer

        Creates a new AffineImageTransformer based on the specified BasicImageTransformations.
        Parameters:
        transformations - the BasicImageTransformations to be applied to source images. This argument cannot be null.
        bckgColor - the Color to set the pixels of the destination image to where no pixels of the source image are transformed. This argument cannot be null.
        interpolationType - the interpolation algorithm to be used when transforming the source image. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

    • Method Detail

      • getTransformationMatrix

        public static java.awt.geom.AffineTransform getTransformationMatrix(BasicImageTransformations transformations)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates an affine transformation from the given BasicImageTransformations.

        This method will assume that the top-left corner of the image is at (0, 0) and the bottom-right corner of the image is at the (width - 1, height - 1) coordinates. The transformations will be applied in the following order:

        1. Scaling: Multiplies the coordinates with ZoomX and ZoomY appropriately.
        2. Flips the image if specified so. Vertical flip is equivalent to multiplying the Y coordinate with -1, while horizontal flipping is equivalent to multiplying the X coordinate with -1.
        3. Rotates the points of the image around (0, 0). Counterclockwise, assuming that the x axis oriented from left to right, and the y axis is oriented from bottom to top. Notice that this is different from the usual display of images.
        4. Adds the specified offsets to the appropriate coordinates.
        Notice that if you translate the image (before applying the returned transformation) so, that the center of the image will be at (0, 0) the center of the image will be at the offset of the specified transformation.
        Parameters:
        transformations - the BasicImageTransformations from which the affine transformations are to be calculated. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the affine transformation created from the given BasicImageTransformations. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified argument is null

      • getTransformationMatrix

        public static java.awt.geom.AffineTransform getTransformationMatrix(BasicImageTransformations transformations,
                                                    double srcWidth,
                                                    double srcHeight,
                                                    double destWidth,
                                                    double destHeight)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates an affine transformation from the given BasicImageTransformations object assuming the specified source and destination image sizes.

        The offset is defined so, that (0, 0) offset means that the center of the source image will be transformed to the center of the destination image.

        Parameters:
        transformations - the BasicImageTransformations to be applied to the image. This argument cannot be null.
        srcWidth - the assumed width of the source image in pixels
        srcHeight - the assumed height of the source image in pixels
        destWidth - the assumed width of the destination image in pixels
        destHeight - the assumed height of the destination image in pixels
        Returns:
        the affine transformation from the given BasicImageTransformations object assuming the specified source and destination image sizes. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified BasicImageTransformations is null

      • getTransformationMatrix

        public static java.awt.geom.AffineTransform getTransformationMatrix(BasicImageTransformations transformations,
                                                    ImageTransformerData input)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates an affine transformation from the given BasicImageTransformations object assuming the source and destination image sizes specified in the given ImageTransformerData.

        In case the specified ImageTransformerData does not contain the width or height of the source image (either by having a source image or meta-data), this method returns an identity transformation.

        The offset is defined so, that (0, 0) offset means that the center of the source image will be transformed to the center of the destination image.

        Parameters:
        transformations - the BasicImageTransformations to be applied to the image. This argument cannot be null.
        input - the ImageTransformerData from which the assumed width and height of the source and destination image is to be extracted. This method cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the affine transformation from the given BasicImageTransformations object assuming the source and destination image sizes specified in the given ImageTransformerData. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

      • isSimpleTransformation

        public static boolean isSimpleTransformation(BasicImageTransformations transformation)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns true if for the given transformation, the nearest neighbor interpolation should be considered optimal.
        Parameters:
        transformation - the BasicImageTransformations to be checked. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        true if for the given transformation, the nearest neighbor interpolation should be considered optimal, false if other interpolations may produce better results
